Introduction

spatialist is an R package.

Once installed, the package can be loaded and attached to your current workspace as follows:

library(spatialist)

Other helpful libraries.

library(ggplot2)

Demonstration

Input file 

input_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".jpg")
dir.create(dirname(input_file))
download.file(url = "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOCPWTCh3keAMBioweiqUf0PZHOaxIUCekJThB9=s1360-w1360-h1020", destfile = input_file)

Output types 

spatial_thing <- spatialise(
  path = input_file
)
print(spatial_thing)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 7
#>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density
#>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>  
#> 1 JPEG    1209   1020 sRGB       FALSE   377244 72x72

spatial_thing <- spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "flatten",
  extras = list(
    image_flatten = list(operator = "Modulate")
  )
)
print(spatial_thing)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 7
#>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density
#>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>  
#> 1 JPEG    1209   1020 sRGB       FALSE        0 72x72

spatial_thing <- spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "data"
)
spatial_thing
#> 3 channel 1209x1020 bitmap array: 'bitmap' raw [1:3, 1:1209, 1:1020] ff ff ff ff ...
spatial_thing <- spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "matrix"
)
dim(spatial_thing)
#> [1] 1209 1020
spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "heatmap"
)

spatial_thing <- spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "xy"
)
head(spatial_thing)
#>     x  y
#> 1 156 -1
#> 2 190 -1
#> 3 260 -1
#> 4 315 -1
#> 5 322 -1
#> 6 359 -1
spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "point",
  downsample = 100
) + theme_void()

spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "jitter",
  downsample = 100,
  jitter = 5
) + theme_void()

spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "spatial",
  downsample = 150,
  jitter = 3,
  point.size = 0.5,
  extras = list(
    cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 9)
  )
) + 
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(NA, -90)) +
  theme_void() + guides(colour = "none") +
  scale_colour_brewer(palette = "Paired")

spatialise(
  path = input_file,
  return.type = "visium",
  downsample = 50,
  extras = list(
    cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 10)
  )
) + 
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(NA, -90)) +
  theme_void() + guides(colour = "none") +
  scale_colour_brewer(palette = "Paired")

Additional information

The GitHub repository contains the development version of the package, where new functionality is added over time. The authors appreciate well-considered suggestions for improvements or new features, or even better, pull requests.

If you use spatialist for your analysis, please cite it as shown below:

citation("spatialist")
#> To cite package 'spatialist' in publications use:
#> 
#>   Rue-Albrecht K (2024). _spatialist: Spatialise images_. R package
#>   version 0.1.0, <https://github.com/kevinrue/spatialist>.
#> 
#> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is
#> 
#>   @Manual{,
#>     title = {spatialist: Spatialise images},
#>     author = {Kevin Rue-Albrecht},
#>     year = {2024},
#>     note = {R package version 0.1.0},
#>     url = {https://github.com/kevinrue/spatialist},
#>   }
